text:
> sure, I know... `Trapezoid` is the fastest I've found so far, but still takes small step sizes, it seems.
Even faster than TRBDF2? That would be odd to me.

elements.text: is the fastest I've found so far, but still takes small step sizes, it seems.
Even faster than TRBDF2? That would be odd to me.

text: Yes more than twice as fast as TRBDF2 for the same tolerance.

elements.text: Yes more than twice as fast as TRBDF2 for the same tolerance.

text: well I have no analytical expression to compare against.

elements.text: well I have no analytical expression to compare against.

text: although I should be able to find one

elements.text: although I should be able to find one

text: you can solve with an extremely low tolerance to generate one.

elements.text: you can solve with an extremely low tolerance to generate one.

text: that's how the work-precision diagrams are made

elements.text: that's how the work-precision diagrams are made

text: My guess is that it has something to do with handling the error due to the discontinuity of the phase change.

elements.text: My guess is that it has something to do with handling the error due to the discontinuity of the phase change.

text: Some error estimators might be more willing to let that fly, while others will need to hit it almost exactly for the error estimator to be satisfied (which in theory is correct, but requires more steps)

elements.text: Some error estimators might be more willing to let that fly, while others will need to hit it almost exactly for the error estimator to be satisfied (which in theory is correct, but requires more steps)

text: If you can share an example it would be nice

elements.text: If you can share an example it would be nice

text: we actually have some new special integrators in the pipeline specifically for these kinds of phase change issues.

elements.text: we actually have some new special integrators in the pipeline specifically for these kinds of phase change issues.

text: hmm. well there's a lot of code, it's a general-purpose model.

elements.text: hmm. well there's a lot of code, it's a general-purpose model.

text: I think I have a simpler version laying around somewhere, but I don't think it handles phase change correctly, I'll have to check.
